entry.title: WiX Toolset security releases available
entry.summary: FireGiant has fixed two security vulnerabilities in WiX v3.14.1, WiX v4.0.5, and WiX v5.0.0-rc.2. For details, see the FireGiant blog post, the first security advisory, and the second security advisory.
entry.content: FireGiant has fixed two security vulnerabilities in WiX v3.14.1, WiX v4.0.5, and WiX v5.0.0-rc.2. For details, see the FireGiant blog post, the first security advisory, and the second security advisory.

entry.title: WiX Toolset v4.0.4 and v3.14 available
entry.summary: WiX v4.0.4 and v3.14 mitigate a Windows DLL redirection vulnerability in Burn. All versions of WiX are affected by this vulnerability. We recommending upgrading to these versions as soon as possible. Read more about it at the FireGiant blog.
entry.content: WiX v4.0.4 and v3.14 mitigate a Windows DLL redirection vulnerability in Burn. All versions of WiX are affected by this vulnerability. We recommending upgrading to these versions as soon as possible. Read more about it at the FireGiant blog.

entry.title: WiX Toolset v3.11.2 released
entry.summary: WiX v3.11.2 is a minor security release of WiX. If your application directly references Microsoft.Deployment.Compression.Cab.dll or Microsoft.Deployment.Compression.Zip.dll to decompress cabinet or zip files to a folder, you should upgrade to this release.
entry.content:
WiX v3.11.2 is a minor security release of WiX. If your application directly references Microsoft.Deployment.Compression.Cab.dll or Microsoft.Deployment.Compression.Zip.dll to decompress cabinet or zip files to a folder, you should upgrade to this release.

Read more about the release at FireGiant's blog.

entry.title: WiX Toolset Visual Studio Extension v1.0 released (with VS2019 support)
entry.summary: Today the WiX Toolset Visual Studio Extension v1.0 (Votive v1.0) was published to the Visual Studio marketplace. This includes support for Visual Studio 2019. Huge thanks to the team at FireGiant for their persistence with the publishing process.
entry.content: Today the WiX Toolset Visual Studio Extension v1.0 (Votive v1.0) was published to the Visual Studio marketplace. This includes support for Visual Studio 2019. Huge thanks to the team at FireGiant for their persistence with the publishing process.

entry.title: WiX Toolset v3.10.4 and v3.11.1 released
entry.summary: WiX v3.10.4 and WiX v3.11.1 are important security releases of WiX. We strongly encourage all users of WiX to upgrade to WiX v3.11.1. If you must remain on a WiX v3.10 release, we highly recommend upgrading to WiX v3.10.4.
entry.content:
WiX v3.10.4 and WiX v3.11.1 are important security releases of WiX. We strongly encourage all users of WiX to upgrade to WiX v3.11.1. If you must remain on a WiX v3.10 release, we highly recommend upgrading to WiX v3.10.4.

Read more about the release at FireGiant's blog.

entry.title: WiX Toolset v3.11 RC2 available

entry.title: WiX Toolset v3.11 RC available

entry.title: WiX Toolset Visual Studio 2017 preview available
entry.summary: With the release of Visual Studio 2017 just around the corner, the team at FireGiant came through and produced a preview of the WiX Toolset Visual Studio 2017 Extension. We'll have more information about our changing support for Visual Studio when the WiX v3.11 release candidate drops next week. Today you can try out the VS2017 Extension preview.
entry.content: With the release of Visual Studio 2017 just around the corner, the team at FireGiant came through and produced a preview of the WiX Toolset Visual Studio 2017 Extension. We'll have more information about our changing support for Visual Studio when the WiX v3.11 release candidate drops next week. Today you can try out the VS2017 Extension preview.

entry.title: WiX v3.10.3 released
entry.summary: WiX v3.10.3 includes the mitigations in WiX v3.10.2 for a serious Windows vulnerability affecting all bundles and fixes for regressions introduced with the mitigations. We strongly recommend you upgrade to WiX v3.10.3 as soon as possible. You can read more on Rob's blog and Bob's blog.
entry.content: WiX v3.10.3 includes the mitigations in WiX v3.10.2 for a serious Windows vulnerability affecting all bundles and fixes for regressions introduced with the mitigations. We strongly recommend you upgrade to WiX v3.10.3 as soon as possible. You can read more on Rob's blog and Bob's blog.

entry.title: WiX v3.10.2 released
entry.summary: WiX v3.10.2 is an important security release of the WiX toolset. All users of WiX's Burn engine should upgrade to WiX v3.10.2 as soon as possible. Special thanks to FireGiant for rapidly and responsibly addressing the issue. They have more details on their blog.
entry.content: WiX v3.10.2 is an important security release of the WiX toolset. All users of WiX's Burn engine should upgrade to WiX v3.10.2 as soon as possible. Special thanks to FireGiant for rapidly and responsibly addressing the issue. They have more details on their blog.

entry.title: New WiX Mailing Lists
entry.summary: Due to an extended outage at SourceForge, the FireGiant team stood up standalone mailing lists for the WiX Toolset overnight. Moving our mailing lists off of SourceForge has been on our wish list for a long time, so a huge thanks to FireGiant for doing this for us on short notice. Sign up for the new lists as per our documentation.
entry.content: Due to an extended outage at SourceForge, the FireGiant team stood up standalone mailing lists for the WiX Toolset overnight. Moving our mailing lists off of SourceForge has been on our wish list for a long time, so a huge thanks to FireGiant for doing this for us on short notice. Sign up for the new lists as per our documentation.

entry.title: Web site restored
entry.summary: This week the the WiX website was down due to a software failure in the
entry.content: This week the the WiX website was down due to a software failure in the server's RAID controller. Fortunately the software was fixed and all data was restored. Thank you for your patience as we worked to bring the site back up.

entry.title: Web site outage
entry.summary: Earlier this week the the WiX website suffered a catastrophic hardware failure.
entry.content: Earlier this week the the WiX website suffered a catastrophic hardware failure. The website is now back up but the issue tracker and recent releases are still offline. Follow the @wixtoolset for future updates.

entry.title: WiX Toolset turns 9
entry.summary: It was 9 years ago today that the WiX toolset was released as Open Source. Thank you for your participation and we look forward to many more years!
entry.content: It was 9 years ago today that the WiX toolset was released as Open Source. Thank you for your participation and we look forward to many more years!

entry.content: Unfortunately, a crashing bug was found in Votive so the escrow build was reset. WiX v3.5.2403.0 is the new escrow build. Again, this could be our final build so upgrade and help us find any showstoppers.

entry.title: WiX v3.5 Votive integration with Visual Studio 2010 available
entry.summary: The WiX Working Group and the Visual Studio team are pleased to announce that Votive integration in Visual Studio 2010 Beta 1 is now available in WiX v3.5. We encourage all Visual Studio 2010 Beta 1 users to upgrade to the latest build of WiX v3.5 to try out the feature.
entry.content: The WiX Working Group and the Visual Studio team are pleased to announce that Votive integration in Visual Studio 2010 Beta 1 is now available in WiX v3.5. We encourage all Visual Studio 2010 Beta 1 users to upgrade to the latest build of WiX v3.5 to try out the feature.

entry.title: WiX v3.0 release candidate 2 build available
entry.summary: The WiX Working Group is pleased to announced that the WiX v3.0 RC2 build (v3.0.5217.0) is now available. We encourage all users to upgrade to this build for the latest fixes and to verify how ready WiX v3.0 is for release. For more information, see Highlights of WiX v3.0.5217.0 and the release notes. You can download it from http://wix.sourceforge.net/releases/3.0.5217.0/ or from the WiX SourceForge.net releases page.
entry.content: The WiX Working Group is pleased to announced that the WiX v3.0 RC2 build (v3.0.5217.0) is now available. We encourage all users to upgrade to this build for the latest fixes and to verify how ready WiX v3.0 is for release. For more information, see Rob's announcement, Bob's follow-up, and Highlights of WiX v3.0.4805.0. You can download it from http://wix.sourceforge.net/releases/3.0.4805.0/ or from the WiX SourceForge.net releases page.

entry.title: Subscribe to send email, cutting down on spam

entry.content: To help prevent spam on the WiX mailing lists, you must now subscribe to the lists before you can send e-mail to them. See the mailing list page for more information.

entry.title: WiX toolset Production/Stable
entry.summary: The WiX toolset status has been upgraded to Production/Stable to recognize the final build of WiX v2 (2.0.5805.0). See http://robmensching.com/blog/archive/2008/02/17/WiX-toolset-on-SourceForge-marked-ProductionStable.aspx for more information.
entry.content: The WiX toolset status has been upgraded to Production/Stable to recognize the final build of WiX v2 (2.0.5805.0). See http://robmensching.com/blog/archive/2008/02/17/WiX-toolset-on-SourceForge-marked-ProductionStable.aspx for more information.

entry.title: The much exaggerated death of the WiX toolset
entry.summary: There has been some suggestion that the WiX toolset is a dead project because we have not released a drop to the SourceForge release point in a long while. Those fears are unfounded for three reasons. First, WiX v2 is stable so we are not expecting another build of that version unless a showstopper bug shows up. Second, weekly drops show up at the Weekly Releases release point regularly. Finally, pushing to the SourceForge release point is a manual process for us and ends up a lower priority. In any case, development is still very much active and the wix-users mailing list is still the best place to get your questions answered.
entry.content: There has been some suggestion that the WiX toolset is a dead project because we have not released a drop to the SourceForge release point in a long while. Those fears are unfounded for three reasons. First, WiX v2 is stable so we are not expecting another build of that version unless a showstopper bug shows up. Second, weekly drops show up at the Weekly Releases release point regularly. Finally, pushing to the SourceForge release point is a manual process for us and ends up a lower priority. In any case, development is still very much active and the wix-users mailing list is still the best place to get your questions answered.

entry.title: Votive works with Visual Studio 2008
entry.summary: Visual Studio 2008 has recently released and we are happy to announce that Votive is supported in both Visual Studio 2005 and Visual Studio 2008. You can also install Votive side by side on both versions of Visual Studio. Support for Visual Studio 2008 Beta 2 was added in build 3.0.3328 (which also works for Visual Studio 2008 RTM) and the final Visual Studio 2008 RTM bits are in a build >= 3.0.3607, which is available on the weekly releases page.
entry.content: Visual Studio 2008 has recently released and we are happy to announce that Votive is supported in both Visual Studio 2005 and Visual Studio 2008. You can also install Votive side by side on both versions of Visual Studio. Support for Visual Studio 2008 Beta 2 was added in build 3.0.3328 (which also works for Visual Studio 2008 RTM) and the final Visual Studio 2008 RTM bits are in a build >= 3.0.3607, which is available on the weekly releases page.

entry.title: Saying Goodbye to FragmentRef's
entry.summary: After many months of being deprecated, its time to say goodbye (builds >= 3.0.2716.0). All FragmentRef's will need to be converted to one of the supported reference elements in WiX 3.0. Examples of these are ComponentRef, FeatureRef, PropertyRef, or CustomActionRef among others.
entry.content: After many months of being deprecated, its time to say goodbye (builds >= 3.0.2716.0). All FragmentRef's will need to be converted to one of the supported reference elements in WiX 3.0. Examples of these are ComponentRef, FeatureRef, PropertyRef, or CustomActionRef among others.

entry.title: Added a "What's New in WiX v3" FAQ Section
entry.summary: Many people have asked what's new in WiX version 3. Here is a list of things that have already been done and things that are still in the works.
entry.content: Many people have asked what's new in WiX version 3. Here is a list of things that have already been done and things that are still in the works.

entry.title: New Wix3.msi
entry.summary: The old Votive3.msi has been renamed Wix3.msi as of builds >= 3.0.2120.0 to better describe the installer. It is the installation vehicle for installing the core WiX toolset and also Votive, ClickThrough, and other WiX tools.
entry.content: The old Votive3.msi has been renamed Wix3.msi as of builds >= 3.0.2120.0 to better describe the installer. It is the installation vehicle for installing the core WiX toolset and also Votive, ClickThrough, and other WiX tools.

entry.title: Votive v3 Released
entry.summary: A brand new version of Votive has been released in the v3 branch (builds >= 3.0.2120.0). Click here for a list of new features.
entry.content: A brand new version of Votive has been released in the v3 branch (builds >= 3.0.2120.0). Click here for a list of new features.

entry.title: Weekly Releases
entry.summary: On the right you will now see a link to our Weekly Releases. The best way to stay current is to check there each Wednesday around noon PST for the latest build of the WiX toolset.
entry.content: On the right you will now see a link to our Weekly Releases. The best way to stay current is to check there each Wednesday around noon PST for the latest build of the WiX toolset.

entry.title: Introducing ClickThrough
entry.summary: ClickThrough is a new tool built on the core WiX toolset. It provides a GUI to create simple MSI files that auto-update over an RSS feed.
entry.content: ClickThrough is a new tool built on the core WiX toolset. It provides a GUI to create simple MSI files that auto-update over an RSS feed.

entry.title: Introducing the WiX Web Site
entry.summary: The first official WiX web site is now online. Content is a bit scarce initially, but we expect to add a lot more in the near future.
entry.content: The first official WiX web site is now online. Content is a bit scarce initially, but we expect to add a lot more in the near future.
